2023-08-01.name: Grant Park Music Festival
2023-08-01.summary:
Professional musicians, many of them world-famous, offer free concerts nearly every evening in Millennium Park's beautiful Pritzker Pavilion. 
This year's schedule includes favorites by Beethoven, Gershwin and Tchaikovsky as well as choral, circus and Broadway evenings.

2023-08-01.name: National Balloon Classic
2023-08-01.summary: This giant hot-air balloon festival includes daily flights, rides for the public, music, night glows and closing fireworks.

2023-08-01.name: Coast Guard Festival
2023-08-01.summary: There's nightly entertainment on the waterfront, a downtown carnival, tours of Coast Guard cutters, a Grand Parade and fireworks.

2023-08-01.name: Mississippi Valley Fair
2023-08-01.summary: There are chainsaw artists and alligator shows as well as a  carnival and grandstand acts that include national country musicians.

2023-08-02.name: Grant Park Music Festival
2023-08-02.summary:
Professional musicians, many of them world-famous, offer free concerts nearly every evening in Millennium Park's beautiful Pritzker Pavilion. 
This year's schedule includes favorites by Beethoven, Gershwin and Tchaikovsky as well as choral, circus and Broadway evenings.

2023-08-02.name: National Balloon Classic
2023-08-02.summary: This giant hot-air balloon festival includes daily flights, rides for the public, music, night glows and closing fireworks.

2023-08-02.name: Coast Guard Festival
2023-08-02.summary: There's nightly entertainment on the waterfront, a downtown carnival, tours of Coast Guard cutters, a Grand Parade and fireworks.

2023-08-02.name: Mississippi Valley Fair
2023-08-02.summary: There are chainsaw artists and alligator shows as well as a  carnival and grandstand acts that include national country musicians.

2023-08-02.name: Lake Bemidji Dragon Boat Festival
2023-08-02.summary: In addition to boat races, there will be kids' activities, cultural performances, music and a parade of teams.

2023-08-03.name: Grant Park Music Festival
2023-08-03.summary:
Professional musicians, many of them world-famous, offer free concerts nearly every evening in Millennium Park's beautiful Pritzker Pavilion. 
This year's schedule includes favorites by Beethoven, Gershwin and Tchaikovsky as well as choral, circus and Broadway evenings.

2023-08-03.name: National Balloon Classic
2023-08-03.summary: This giant hot-air balloon festival includes daily flights, rides for the public, music, night glows and closing fireworks.

2023-08-03.name: Coast Guard Festival
2023-08-03.summary: There's nightly entertainment on the waterfront, a downtown carnival, tours of Coast Guard cutters, a Grand Parade and fireworks.

2023-08-03.name: Lollapalooza
2023-08-03.summary: This big music festival features more than 170 artists on nine stages and, unlike other Grant Park festivals, is not free. Reserve rooms far in advance. Headliners include Kendrick Lamar, Billie Eilish, Red Hot Chili Peppers and Lana Del Rey.

2023-08-03.name: Mississippi Valley Fair
2023-08-03.summary: There are chainsaw artists and alligator shows as well as a  carnival and grandstand acts that include national country musicians.

2023-08-03.name: Lake Bemidji Dragon Boat Festival
2023-08-03.summary: In addition to boat races, there will be kids' activities, cultural performances, music and a parade of teams.

2023-08-03.name: Wisconsin State Fair
2023-08-03.summary: The fair in this Milwaukee suburb features big-name musicians, a sea-lion show, a daily parade and lots of contests, including hog-calling, cookie-stacking and cream puff-eating.

2023-08-03.name: WE Fest
2023-08-03.summary: Morgan Wallen, Brad Paisley and Kane Brown are among the headliners at this big country festival in west-central Minnesota.

2023-08-03.name: Mile of Music
2023-08-03.summary: More than 180 singer-songwriters perform at more than 40 venues along College Avenue downtown.

2023-08-03.name: Blues on the Chippewa
2023-08-03.summary: Just up the Chippewa River from Lake Pepin, this free blues festival in Memorial Park features 16 bands.

2023-08-03.name: Fisherman's Picnic
2023-08-03.summary: There's a lot going on at the North Shore's biggest festival, including loon-calling, log-rolling, herring-eating and rock-skipping contests; Saturday fireworks; and the grand parade on Sunday.

2023-08-03.name: Bix Beiderbecke Memorial Jazz Festival
2023-08-03.summary: Since 1972, fans of this Jazz Age cornetist and composer have held this festival in his hometown on the Mississippi.

2023-08-04.name: Grant Park Music Festival
2023-08-04.summary:
Professional musicians, many of them world-famous, offer free concerts nearly every evening in Millennium Park's beautiful Pritzker Pavilion. 
This year's schedule includes favorites by Beethoven, Gershwin and Tchaikovsky as well as choral, circus and Broadway evenings.

2023-08-04.name: Lollapalooza
2023-08-04.summary: This big music festival features more than 170 artists on nine stages and, unlike other Grant Park festivals, is not free. Reserve rooms far in advance. Headliners include Kendrick Lamar, Billie Eilish, Red Hot Chili Peppers and Lana Del Rey.

2023-08-04.name: Mississippi Valley Fair
2023-08-04.summary: There are chainsaw artists and alligator shows as well as a  carnival and grandstand acts that include national country musicians.

2023-08-04.name: Lake Bemidji Dragon Boat Festival
2023-08-04.summary: In addition to boat races, there will be kids' activities, cultural performances, music and a parade of teams.

2023-08-04.name: Wisconsin State Fair
2023-08-04.summary: The fair in this Milwaukee suburb features big-name musicians, a sea-lion show, a daily parade and lots of contests, including hog-calling, cookie-stacking and cream puff-eating.

2023-08-04.name: WE Fest
2023-08-04.summary: Morgan Wallen, Brad Paisley and Kane Brown are among the headliners at this big country festival in west-central Minnesota.

2023-08-04.name: Mile of Music
2023-08-04.summary: More than 180 singer-songwriters perform at more than 40 venues along College Avenue downtown.

2023-08-04.name: Buffalo Bill Days
2023-08-04.summary: Ride the Root River State Trail, then enjoy music, kids' games, sports tournaments, fireworks and a parade on Sunday.

2023-08-04.name: Uptown Art Fair
2023-08-04.summary: This large juried art fair in the Uptown neighborhood draws crowds. Use a Nice Ride bike or download a free bus/train pass to avoid congestion.

2023-08-04.name: Festa Italiana
2023-08-04.summary: This festival at the Naper Settlement is a showcase for Italian culture, food, music and artisans and has two entertainment stages.

2023-08-04.name: Pie Day
2023-08-04.summary: Minnesota's official Pie Capital near Cambridge holds pie-eating contests, a pie trivia contest and performances of the             Pie-Alleuia Chorus.

2023-08-04.name: Blues on the Chippewa
2023-08-04.summary: Just up the Chippewa River from Lake Pepin, this free blues festival in Memorial Park features 16 bands.

2023-08-04.name: Fisherman's Picnic
2023-08-04.summary: There's a lot going on at the North Shore's biggest festival, including loon-calling, log-rolling, herring-eating and rock-skipping contests; Saturday fireworks; and the grand parade on Sunday.

2023-08-04.name: Bix Beiderbecke Memorial Jazz Festival
2023-08-04.summary: Since 1972, fans of this Jazz Age cornetist and composer have held this festival in his hometown on the Mississippi.

2023-08-04.name: River City Days
2023-08-04.summary: In this Mississippi River town, there's music, food and games in Bay Point Park and an arts show in Levee Park. The parade is at 1 p.m. Sunday.

2023-08-04.name: Tall Timber Days
2023-08-04.summary: In this longtime logging town, there will be lumberjack shows, chainsaw carving, music and a parade Sunday.

2023-08-04.name: Pufferbilly Days
2023-08-04.summary: This festival in central Iowa, just west of Ames, is named for a steam engine and features a spike-driving contest, mud volleyball and rides on the Boone and Scenic Valley Railroad. A parade is Saturday.

Professional musicians, many of them world-famous, offer free concerts nearly every evening in Millennium Park's beautiful Pritzker Pavilion. 
This year's schedule includes favorites by Beethoven, Gershwin and Tchaikovsky as well as choral, circus and Broadway evenings.

2023-08-10.name: Folklorama
2023-08-10.summary: This Manitoba prairie town celebrates its heritage with pavilions representing 44 nationalities, offering music, dance and food at many venues.

2023-08-10.name: Wisconsin State Fair
2023-08-10.summary: The fair in this Milwaukee suburb features big-name musicians, a sea-lion show, a daily parade and lots of contests, including hog-calling, cookie-stacking and cream puff-eating.

2023-08-10.name: Iowa State Fair
2023-08-10.summary: See a diaper derby, outhouse races and mullet contest, among many other contests, and don't miss the butter sculptures.

2023-08-10.name: Minnesota Bluegrass & Old-Time Music Festival
2023-08-10.summary: This family-friendly festival includes music             on five stages and workshops at El Rancho Mañana Campground, 20 miles west of St. Cloud.

2023-08-10.name: National Blueberry Festival
2023-08-10.summary: Eat until you're blue in the face during the festival in this Lake Michigan beach town. There's a pie-eating contest, riverfront concerts, an arts fair and a big parade on Saturday.

2023-08-10.name: Ashley for the Arts music festival
2023-08-10.summary:
This nonprofit festival is in the southwest Wisconsin bluffs, half an hour north of Winona, Minn.

Trace Adkins and Tyler Hubbard are among the headliners, which include a variety of country and rock stars. Thursday admission is free, and Friday-Saturday tickets are $20-$30. In addition to music, there will be an arts fair, children's activities and Saturday fireworks.

2023-08-10.name: Tug Fest
2023-08-10.summary: The two towns stretch a 680-pound, 2,400-foot rope across the Mississippi River for the ultimate tug of war. There's also a parade, fireworks, children's games, concerts and carnival rides. Score so far: Illinois 24, Iowa 11.

2023-08-10.name: Grand Marais Music Festival
2023-08-10.summary: In addition to music, there will be food and arts and crafts vendors.

2023-08-10.name: Sweet Corn Festival
2023-08-10.summary: The festival in this town between Rochelle and La Salle features nearly 50 tons of free buttered corn, live music, a flea market, a carnival and a parade.

2023-08-11.name: Grant Park Music Festival
2023-08-11.summary:
Professional musicians, many of them world-famous, offer free concerts nearly every evening in Millennium Park's beautiful Pritzker Pavilion. 
This year's schedule includes favorites by Beethoven, Gershwin and Tchaikovsky as well as choral, circus and Broadway evenings.

2023-08-11.name: Folklorama
2023-08-11.summary: This Manitoba prairie town celebrates its heritage with pavilions representing 44 nationalities, offering music, dance and food at many venues.

2023-08-11.summary: The fair in this Milwaukee suburb features big-name musicians, a sea-lion show, a daily parade and lots of contests, including hog-calling, cookie-stacking and cream puff-eating.

2023-08-11.name: Cache Ba$h
2023-08-11.summary: This town north of Milwaukee calls itself the Geocache Capital of the Midwest. For the festival, it hides 50 new caches and gives away $1,000 in cash prizes.

2023-08-11.name: Live From the Rock
2023-08-11.summary: This folk festival is on the shores of Lake Superior, east of Thunder Bay near Nipigon. Camping is on-site.

2023-08-11.name: Iowa State Fair
2023-08-11.summary: See a diaper derby, outhouse races and mullet contest, among many other contests, and don't miss the butter sculptures.

2023-08-11.name: Minnesota Bluegrass & Old-Time Music Festival
2023-08-11.summary: This family-friendly festival includes music             on five stages and workshops at El Rancho Mañana Campground, 20 miles west of St. Cloud.

2023-08-11.name: National Blueberry Festival
2023-08-11.summary: Eat until you're blue in the face during the festival in this Lake Michigan beach town. There's a pie-eating contest, riverfront concerts, an arts fair and a big parade on Saturday.

2023-08-11.name: Ashley for the Arts music festival
2023-08-11.summary:
This nonprofit festival is in the southwest Wisconsin bluffs, half an hour north of Winona, Minn.

Trace Adkins and Tyler Hubbard are among the headliners, which include a variety of country and rock stars. Thursday admission is free, and Friday-Saturday tickets are $20-$30. In addition to music, there will be an arts fair, children's activities and Saturday fireworks.

2023-08-11.name: Grand Portage Powwow & Rendezvous
2023-08-11.summary: Re-enactors from across the continent gather at Grand Portage National Monument for the annual fur-trade rendezvous; next door, the  Grand Portage Band of Lake Superior Chippewa holds a powwow. Reserve lodgings far in advance.

2023-08-11.name: Bayfront Blues Festival
2023-08-11.summary: The annual music fest on the Lake Superior harbor showcases national and regional             acts on three stages.

2023-08-11.name: Irish Fair
2023-08-11.summary: This big heritage fest on the banks of the Mississippi includes Irish  Got Talent and best legs in a kilt contests, hurling demonstrations,  dancing and lots of music.

2023-08-11.name: Quad Cities Balloon Festival
2023-08-11.summary: This festival at the Rock Island County Fairgrounds includes balloon glows, launches, tethered rides and a play area for children.

2023-08-11.name: Shawano Folk Music Festival
2023-08-11.summary: The free, family-friendly festival in this northwoods town includes dance, crafts, children's activities and instruction in Franklin Park.

2023-08-11.name: Tug Fest
2023-08-11.summary: The two towns stretch a 680-pound, 2,400-foot rope across the Mississippi River for the ultimate tug of war. There's also a parade, fireworks, children's games, concerts and carnival rides. Score so far: Illinois 24, Iowa 11.

2023-08-11.name: Grand Marais Music Festival
2023-08-11.summary: In addition to music, there will be food and arts and crafts vendors.

2023-08-11.name: Sweet Corn Festival
2023-08-11.summary: The festival in this town between Rochelle and La Salle features nearly 50 tons of free buttered corn, live music, a flea market, a carnival and a parade.

2023-08-12.name: Shawano Folk Music Festival
2023-08-12.summary: The free, family-friendly festival in this northwoods town includes dance, crafts, children's activities and instruction in Franklin Park.

2023-08-12.name: Pure Water Days
2023-08-12.summary: There's a big 1 p.m. parade downtown, followed by Riverfest in Allen Park.

2023-08-12.name: Tug Fest
2023-08-12.summary: The two towns stretch a 680-pound, 2,400-foot rope across the Mississippi River for the ultimate tug of war. There's also a parade, fireworks, children's games, concerts and carnival rides. Score so far: Illinois 24, Iowa 11.

2023-08-12.name: Grand Marais Music Festival
2023-08-12.summary: In addition to music, there will be food and arts and crafts vendors.

2023-08-12.name: Sweet Corn Festival
2023-08-12.summary: The festival in this town between Rochelle and La Salle features nearly 50 tons of free buttered corn, live music, a flea market, a carnival and a parade.

2023-08-12.name: Burger Fest
2023-08-12.summary: This town west of Green Bay calls itself Home of the Hamburger, based  on a local 15-year-old who put ground-beef patties in a bun, called  them hamburgers and sold them at the Seymour Fair in 1885.

2023-08-12.name: IndiaFest
2023-08-12.summary: On the State Capitol grounds, watch Bollywood dance and a parade of cultures, eat East Indian food, get your hands painted with henna and learn the principles of cricket and yoga.

2023-08-13.name: Grant Park Music Festival
2023-08-13.summary:
Professional musicians, many of them world-famous, offer free concerts nearly every evening in Millennium Park's beautiful Pritzker Pavilion. 
This year's schedule includes favorites by Beethoven, Gershwin and Tchaikovsky as well as choral, circus and Broadway evenings.

2023-08-13.name: Folklorama
2023-08-13.summary: This Manitoba prairie town celebrates its heritage with pavilions representing 44 nationalities, offering music, dance and food at many venues.

2023-08-13.name: Wisconsin State Fair
2023-08-13.summary: The fair in this Milwaukee suburb features big-name musicians, a sea-lion show, a daily parade and lots of contests, including hog-calling, cookie-stacking and cream puff-eating.

2023-08-13.name: Live From the Rock
2023-08-13.summary: This folk festival is on the shores of Lake Superior, east of Thunder Bay near Nipigon. Camping is on-site.

2023-08-13.name: Iowa State Fair
2023-08-13.summary: See a diaper derby, outhouse races and mullet contest, among many other contests, and don't miss the butter sculptures.

2023-08-13.name: Minnesota Bluegrass & Old-Time Music Festival
2023-08-13.summary: This family-friendly festival includes music             on five stages and workshops at El Rancho Mañana Campground, 20 miles west of St. Cloud.

2023-08-13.name: National Blueberry Festival
2023-08-13.summary: Eat until you're blue in the face during the festival in this Lake Michigan beach town. There's a pie-eating contest, riverfront concerts, an arts fair and a big parade on Saturday.

2023-08-13.name: Bayfront Blues Festival
2023-08-13.summary: The annual music fest on the Lake Superior harbor showcases national and regional             acts on three stages.

2023-08-13.name: Irish Fair
2023-08-13.summary: This big heritage fest on the banks of the Mississippi includes Irish  Got Talent and best legs in a kilt contests, hurling demonstrations,  dancing and lots of music.

2023-08-13.name: Shawano Folk Music Festival
2023-08-13.summary: The free, family-friendly festival in this northwoods town includes dance, crafts, children's activities and instruction in Franklin Park.

2023-08-13.name: Sweet Corn Festival
2023-08-13.summary: The festival in this town between Rochelle and La Salle features nearly 50 tons of free buttered corn, live music, a flea market, a carnival and a parade.

This year's schedule includes favorites by Beethoven, Gershwin and Tchaikovsky as well as choral, circus and Broadway evenings.

2023-08-14.summary: This Manitoba prairie town celebrates its heritage with pavilions representing 44 nationalities, offering music, dance and food at many venues.

2023-08-14.name: Iowa State Fair
2023-08-14.summary: See a diaper derby, outhouse races and mullet contest, among many other contests, and don't miss the butter sculptures.

2023-08-16.name: Iowa State Fair
2023-08-16.summary: See a diaper derby, outhouse races and mullet contest, among many other contests, and don't miss the butter sculptures.

2023-08-16.name: Venetian Festival
2023-08-16.summary: In this southeast Wisconsin vacation area, the festival includes a carnival, arts and crafts fair, firefighter water fight and, on Sunday, a water-ski show followed by a lighted boat parade and fireworks.

2023-08-16.name: Sweet Corn Festival
2023-08-16.summary: A Wednesday-night parade kicks off this festival just north of Madison, and there's also a craft fair, car show, tractor pull, music, carnival rides and, on Saturday and Sunday, literally tons of steamed sweet corn.

2023-08-17.name: Grant Park Music Festival
2023-08-17.summary:
Professional musicians, many of them world-famous, offer free concerts nearly every evening in Millennium Park's beautiful Pritzker Pavilion. 
This year's schedule includes favorites by Beethoven, Gershwin and Tchaikovsky as well as choral, circus and Broadway evenings.

2023-08-17.name: Venetian Festival
2023-08-17.summary: In this southeast Wisconsin vacation area, the festival includes a carnival, arts and crafts fair, firefighter water fight and, on Sunday, a water-ski show followed by a lighted boat parade and fireworks.

2023-08-17.name: Irish Fest
2023-08-17.summary: The nation's largest Irish festival features 100 acts on 16 stages, plus children's activities, red hair and freckle contests and demonstrations by Irish dog breeds. In Henry Maier Festival Park.

2023-08-17.name: Ki-Chi-Saga Days
2023-08-17.summary: The fest in this town just north of St. Paul features a skateboard contest, craft fair, Swedish dancers, a pie-eating contest, fireworks Saturday and a parade at 2 p.m. Sunday.

2023-08-17.name: Sweet Corn Festival
2023-08-17.summary: A Wednesday-night parade kicks off this festival just north of Madison, and there's also a craft fair, car show, tractor pull, music, carnival rides and, on Saturday and Sunday, literally tons of steamed sweet corn.

2023-08-18.name: Irish Fest
2023-08-18.summary: The nation's largest Irish festival features 100 acts on 16 stages, plus children's activities, red hair and freckle contests and demonstrations by Irish dog breeds. In Henry Maier Festival Park.

2023-08-18.name: Blues, Brews & BBQ
2023-08-18.summary: Listen to the blues and eat barbecued foods in Petersen Park on McCollum Lake.

2023-08-18.name: Oronoco Gold Rush
2023-08-18.summary: The antiques show and flea market in this friendly little village just north of Rochester off U.S. 52 includes more than 400 vendors and 1,200 booths. There's also pancakes for breakfast, homemade pie and music.

2023-08-18.name: Big Bull Falls Blues Fest
2023-08-18.summary: Enjoy national and local blues musicians in Fern Island Park. There's a beer garden, of course.

2023-08-18.name: Evanston Art & Big Fork Festival
2023-08-18.summary: This downtown festival features more than 130 juried artists and art demonstrations, plus food and music.

2023-08-18.name: Winnie The Pooh Festival
2023-08-18.summary: The hometown of the famous children's-book bear celebrates with a block party, bounce houses, parades and fireworks.

2023-08-18.name: Mineral Point Blues & Roots Fest
2023-08-18.summary: The  music fest in this charming town in southwest Wisconsin is held on the grounds of the 1868 Orchard Lawn mansion.

2023-08-18.name: Ki-Chi-Saga Days
2023-08-18.summary: The fest in this town just north of St. Paul features a skateboard contest, craft fair, Swedish dancers, a pie-eating contest, fireworks Saturday and a parade at 2 p.m. Sunday.

2023-08-18.name: Sweet Corn Festival
2023-08-18.summary: A Wednesday-night parade kicks off this festival just north of Madison, and there's also a craft fair, car show, tractor pull, music, carnival rides and, on Saturday and Sunday, literally tons of steamed sweet corn.

2023-08-18.name: Ribfest Chicago
2023-08-18.summary: This street festival in the Northcenter neighborhood, on Lincoln Avenue between Irving Park Road and Warner Avenue, features barbecue plus indie, roots, rock and alt country music.

2023-08-18.name: Shakopee Mdewakanton Wacipi
2023-08-18.summary: The Shakopee Mdewakanton Sioux Community powwow in this southwest Minneapolis suburb includes a moccasin games tournament, food, crafts, fireworks at 10 p.m. Saturday and, of course, dance. Don't miss the Grand Entries at 7 p.m. Friday, 1 and 7 p.m. Saturday and 1 p.m. Sunday.

2023-08-19.name: Art & Chalk Fest
2023-08-19.summary: Outside the Museum of Wisconsin Art, there will be chalk-art workshops for kids, artist demonstrations, balloon art, food, a beer garden, and music all day. Museum admission is free.

2023-08-19.name: Winnie The Pooh Festival
2023-08-19.summary: The hometown of the famous children's-book bear celebrates with a block party, bounce houses, parades and fireworks.

2023-08-19.name: PastyFest
2023-08-19.summary: The humble miner's lunch — meat and rutabagas in a pocket of pie crust — has inspired this Keweenaw Peninsula festival, which includes such events as a PastyWalk, PastyPoetry contest and, of course, a PastyCook-Off.

2023-08-19.summary: The  music fest in this charming town in southwest Wisconsin is held on the grounds of the 1868 Orchard Lawn mansion.

2023-08-19.name: Soar on the Shore
2023-08-19.summary: Learn about kite-flying from professionals on Lake Michigan's Crescent Beach. There will be giant-kite and stunt shows and crafts and a candy drop for kids.

2023-08-19.name: Air & Water Show
2023-08-19.summary: The annual free show features aerobatics, extreme flying and parachuting off North Avenue Beach, from 10 a.m. to 2 p.m. both days.

2023-08-19.name: HarborPark Jazz, Rhythm & Blues Festival
2023-08-19.summary: This free music festival is in the lakefront Celebration Place.

2023-08-19.name: Anishinaabe Keeshigun
2023-08-19.summary: The annual celebration of Anishinaabe/Ojibwe culture at Fort William Historical Park features a powwow, entertainment, demonstrations and a community feast.

2023-08-23.name: Lakes Bluegrass Festival
2023-08-23.summary: This family-friendly festival, just off the Paul Bunyan State Trail, features more than 40 bluegrass shows and free workshops.

2023-08-24.name: Lakes Bluegrass Festival
2023-08-24.summary: This family-friendly festival, just off the Paul Bunyan State Trail, features more than 40 bluegrass shows and free workshops.

2023-08-24.name: Minnesota State Fair
2023-08-24.summary: Try flights at the Craft Beer Hall, eat food on a stick, visit the Miracle of Birth barn, listen to free concerts and watch the 2 p.m. daily parade.

2023-08-25.name: Lakes Bluegrass Festival
2023-08-25.summary: This family-friendly festival, just off the Paul Bunyan State Trail, features more than 40 bluegrass shows and free workshops.

2023-08-25.name: Minnesota State Fair
2023-08-25.summary: Try flights at the Craft Beer Hall, eat food on a stick, visit the Miracle of Birth barn, listen to free concerts and watch the 2 p.m. daily parade.

2023-08-25.name: Artstreet
2023-08-25.summary: Artists, performers and craft and food             stands fill streets downtown near the Fox River.

2023-08-25.name: Milwaukee Oktoberfest
2023-08-25.summary: There will be dachshund racing, stein-hoisting and brat-eating competitions as well as music and dancing at the War Memorial on the lakefront.

2023-08-25.name: Potato Days
2023-08-25.summary: This goofy central-Minnesota festival features mashed-potato wrestling, a golden potato hunt, potato car races, peeling and eating contests and a Saturday parade.

2023-08-25.name: Porcupine Mountains Music Festival
2023-08-25.summary: Few settings are more beautiful than Porcupine Mountains Wilderness State Park on Lake Superior; 25 national and regional blues, folk and bluegrass acts perform.

2023-08-25.name: Mexican Fiesta
2023-08-25.summary: Enjoy the best of Mexican culture at the Henry Maier Festival Park: mariachi, arts and crafts, spicy foods and contests: dance, costume, jalapeno-eating and el grito, or shouting.

2023-08-25.name: World Food & Music Festival
2023-08-25.summary: In downtown's East Village, eat at more than 50 cultural cafes for $5 or less (or taste for $1), shop at the world marketplace or listen to musicians strolling the streets or on stage.

2023-08-25.name: HarborFest
2023-08-25.summary: This Lake Superior town celebrates with rock and blues music, a classic car and  motorcycle show, a luge run and inflatables for kids.

2023-08-25.name: Lake Superior Dragon Boat Festival
2023-08-25.summary: The festival on Barker's Island begins Friday with a parade of teams, fireworks and a concert and continues Saturday with races in the harbor and family entertainment.

2023-08-25.name: Great River Folk Festival
2023-08-25.summary: This festival in Riverside Park includes children's activities, a traditional arts and crafts fair and music performances and workshops.

2023-08-26.name: Vinton Boomtown
2023-08-26.summary: Fireworks provided by the Iowa Pyrotechnic Association are the centerpiece for this fest, which includes arts & crafts, food and kids' activities.

2023-08-26.name: Crossroads Blues Festival
2023-08-26.summary: Enjoy a day of blues in Lyran Park, with food from local restaurants.

2023-08-27.name: Lakes Bluegrass Festival
2023-08-27.summary: This family-friendly festival, just off the Paul Bunyan State Trail, features more than 40 bluegrass shows and free workshops.

2023-08-27.summary: Cycle along car-free John Nolen Drive with stops for family activities, food and music in  Brittingham, Olin and Law parks. You can ride, walk or skate.

2023-08-27.name: Millstream Arts Festival
2023-08-27.summary: In addition to a juried art show, the festival in this town at the start of the Lake Wobegon Trail also features music, street performances, history tours and a vintage car and tractor show.

2023-08-27.name: Great River Folk Festival
2023-08-27.summary: This festival in Riverside Park includes children's activities, a traditional arts and crafts fair and music performances and workshops.

2023-08-31.name: Midwest Old Threshers Reunion
2023-08-31.summary: This gathering of steam engines and antique cars, trucks and tractors also features a horse pull, concerts, square dancing and a parade.

2023-08-31.name: Chicago Jazz Festival
2023-08-31.summary: This free festival features music at the Chicago Cultural Center and Millennium Park plus other venues.
